#Text=Parent Without Punishments
#Text=Steps
#Text=Consider if this is right for your child .
#Text=this parenting style will work for children that are cooperative and do n't cause much trouble .
#Text=on the other hand a child that tends to be quite stubborn and is defiant wo n't benefit from it .
#Text=Focus on positive reinforcement .
#Text=because you wo n't be punishing your child you need to focus on praising and encouraging good behaviours as much as possible .
#Text=even the small things matter like getting up on time or putting away their toys without being asked .
#Text=There is no such thing as praising your child too much , this wo n't spoil them
#Text=Make sure to use descriptive praise , instead of saying " good boy "
#Text=say " i really liked how you did your homework without being asked

#Text=Make sure to explain why they are getting the reward , for example  I thought we could go to the movies tonight because of how nice you were to your brother all week " .

column1: #Text=See how to create a reward chart here : https://www.wikihow.com/Set-up-a-Reward-System-for-Children
#Text=Ignore bad behaviours .
#Text=If your child misbehaves , do not give them the attention they are acting out for until they stop .
#Text=Afterwards say something short and quick such as " Thank you for stopping " , then change the subject to something else so you can get on with the day .
#Text=You ca n't ignore behaviours like violence and bullying you have will have to intervene
#Text=Scold worse behaviours .
#Text=It 's important to criticise the behaviour , not the child , so instead of saying " bad girl " , say " I do n't like your behaviour , please stop " .
#Text=Keep in mind that this is n't exactly punishing them , it is just asking them to stop their bad behaviour .
#Text=Punishing would be grounding them or taking away their screen time .
#Text=Make sure your home is judgement-free and listens to everyone 's opinion ; this includes your child 's opinion .
#Text=Never judge your child for their behaviour and always listen to their opinion .
#Text=They deserve a say in how things work .
#Text=This does n't mean they get to dictate everything , but they have an influence on the final decision .
#Text=For example , if a the child wants to go to the park but the mum does n't want to drive there then they could settle on a park that is closer to their home .
#Text=Make sure to support your child and ask what 's wrong when they feel down .
#Text=If you notice a change in their behaviour this could be due to something else that 's happening in their life .
#Text=Ask how school was everyday ( to make sure nothing bad happened )
#Text=and let your child know they can always come and talk to you .
#Text=Be warned that if you judge your child 's actions , even if they were wrong , your child can shut down and stop talking to you .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Sometimes just asking your child politely to do something instead of commanding them to will make them more willing to do it .
#Text=Consider hiring a counsellor if your child 's behaviour or emotions get too out of hand .
#Text=A child that feels loved and listened to will be more likely to cooperate and have good behavior .
#Text=Encourage your child to do things to help around the house - but do n't force them .
#Text=If they do help , reward them .

#Text=Let children learn from their actions , for example if they do n't wash their uniform before school they will have to wear a dirty uniform to school , or if they stay up late they will be tired the next morning .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Never ever hit a child - this is physical abuse and will severely affect your child , especially if you hit them often .
#Text=Do n't say mean things to your child or make fun of them .
#Text=It can lower their self esteem and can be considered emotional and verbal abuse .
